item.title: Flash Nexus Device with Compiled AOSP
item.author: zeqiii@163.com (zeqi)
item.description:
Compiling AOSP

About how to download and build AOSP source code, the android official site has provided us a very detailed instruction, see here

Downloading drivers

What we want is to flash the builded AOSP to a real nexus device, not just test the image on an emulator, so we need to download the drivers for a nexus deivce. From https://developers.google.com/android/nexus/drivers we download sh files to our android source directory.

Run these sh files and type «I ACCEPT», then a «vender» directory will be created in our android source directory.

Flashing

After the building is completed, we copy these «img» file to some directory.

SDK provide us platforms which contains «fastboot». Connect your device and your PC using an USB cable, shutdown the device then press power button and volume down button at the same time, holding them until the device enters fastboot mode. Then use fastboot devices to see if the devices has connected.

Using fastboot flash command to flash the image into the device. For example.

fastboot flash system E:\system.img
fastboot flash userdata E:\userdata.img
fastboot flash boot E:\boot.img
fastboot flash recovery E:\recovery.img
fastboot flash cache E:\cache.img
fastboot flash XXX YOUR_IMG_FILE

Reboot your device.

fastboot reboot

item.title: Methods of Debugging Java Programs
item.author: zeqiii@163.com (zeqi)
item.description:
Debug Java Source Code In Eclipse

Sometimes we want to know how a Java API works. It is a good idea to write a testing program, debug it and step into the API function to see how it works.

But when I first try this, I encounter a problem like this:

To solve this problem.

  1. Select Window->Preferences->Java->Installed JREs

  1. Click Add..., select Standard VM and click Next>, in the dialog, add your JDK_HOME to the JRE home:, give a name for the new JRE definition, then click Finish.

  1. Return to your project, right click on the project and select Properties->Java Build Path->Libraries, select the JRE System Library then click Edit.... Replace the original JRE system library with your newly defined JRE library.

  1. Select Run->Debug Configurations...->Source, add your project folder to the Source Lookup Path.

Let’s debug!

Debug with JDI

Referring to llegalargumentexception.blogspot.com, using Java code to connect to the VM can help us debug a Java program.

The routine to debug.

public class Test {

  int foo;

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    Random random = new Random();
    Test test = new Test();
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
      test.foo = random.nextInt();
      System.out.println(test.foo);
    }
  }
}

Firstly, import tools.jar to the classpath.

Code connecting to the VM:

public class VMAcquirer {

  /**
   * Call this with the localhost port to connect to.
   */
  public VirtualMachine connect(int port)
      throws IOException {
    String strPort = Integer.toString(port);
    AttachingConnector connector = getConnector();
    try {
      VirtualMachine vm = connect(connector, strPort);
      return vm;
    } catch (IllegalConnectorArgumentsException e) {
      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
    }
  }

  private AttachingConnector getConnector() {
    VirtualMachineManager vmManager = Bootstrap
        .virtualMachineManager();
    for (Connector connector : vmManager
        .attachingConnectors()) {
      System.out.println(connector.name());
      if ("com.sun.jdi.SocketAttach".equals(connector
          .name())) {
        return (AttachingConnector) connector;
      }
    }
    throw new IllegalStateException();
  }

  private VirtualMachine connect(
      AttachingConnector connector, String port)
      throws IllegalConnectorArgumentsException,
      IOException {
    Map<String, Connector.Argument> args = connector
        .defaultArguments();
    Connector.Argument pidArgument = args.get("port");
    if (pidArgument == null) {
      throw new IllegalStateException();
    }
    pidArgument.setValue(port);

    return connector.attach(args);
  }

}

item.title: C/C++ Programming knowledge
item.author: zeqiii@163.com (zeqi)
item.description:
Functions, Reserved Words and Macros

reinterpret_cast (expression)

Cast the expression to a new_type.

For example:

typedef int (*FunctionPointer)(int); 
int value = 21; 
FunctionPointer funcP; 
funcP = reinterpret_cast<FunctionPointer> (&value); 
funcP(value);

Of course, this program will crash after being executed.

Macro with variable argument list

For example:

#define LOG(format, ...) fprintf(stdout, format, __VA_ARGS__)

... means the arguments are variable, __VA_ARGS__ represents the variable arguments.

In GCC, we can also:

#define LOG(format, args...) fprintf(stdout, format, args)

With the macros defined above, we can:

LOG("%d,%s", 1, "hello")

size_t

Alias of one of the fundamental unsigned integer types. size_t is unsigned integer defined in standard C lib, in 64-bit OS, it is long unsigned integer.

sizeof operation returns a size_t type value.

size_t usually is used in array index, looping, pointer, memory location calculating.

See more DETAILS.

mutable

mutable variables always can be changed even if it is in a const function.

As we know, if a function doesn’t change any fields of a class, this function will be declared with const. But sometimes this kind of functions need to modify some specific fields that have no business with the state of the class. In this condition, these specific fields should declared with the key word mutable.

volatile

To optimize a program, commonly, the compiler make the executables read/write a variable from registers. But sometimes a varible may be changed frequently.

If a variable are declared with the key word volatile, that means the variable can be changed at any moment, the compiler will compile the program to make this variable be read/write directly from the memory, which helps to avoid race condition.

misc tips

Use g++ to compile your cpp file if you use c++ programming language, otherwise there will be some strange errors during complilation like undefined reference to XXX.
